quote: A woman past forty should make up her mind to be young; not her face.
The girl with a future avoids a man with a past.
For other nations, utopia is a blessed past never to be recovered; for Americans it is just beyond the horizon.
Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future.
What is past is prologue.
A generation which ignores history has no past and no future.
A novelist is, like all mortals, more fully at home on the surface of the present than in the ooze of the past.
A woman past forty should make up her mind to be young; not her face.
The girl with a future avoids a man with a past.
For other nations, utopia is a blessed past never to be recovered; for Americans it is just beyond the horizon.
Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future.
What is past is prologue.
A generation which ignores history has no past and no future.
A novelist is, like all mortals, more fully at home on the surface of the present than in the ooze of the past.
A revolution is not a bed of roses. A revolution is a struggle between the future and the past.
Ah tell me not that memory sheds gladness over the past; what is recalled by faded flowers save that they did not last?
Americans have a penchant for the future and tend to disregard the past.
An expert is someone who knows a lot about the past.
Anyone who doesn't miss the past never had a mother.
As one went to Europe to see the living past, so one must visit Southern California to observe the future.
As youth lives in the future, so the adult lives in the past: No one rightly knows how to live in the present.
Awareness requires living in the here and now, and not in the elsewhere, the past or the future.
Bureaucracy defends the status quo long past the time when the quo has lost its status.
Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
Children enjoy the present because they have neither a past nor a future.
Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present - which seldom happens to us.
Confess yourself to heaven; repent what's past; avoid what is to come.
Create your future from your future not your past.
Do not be afraid of the past. If people tell you that it is irrevocable, do not believe them.
Don't live in the past. There's no point. You can't change anything. What a waste of time.
Don't use the past as an excuse to miss out on your future.
Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book known to him by heart and his friends can only read the title.
Enjoy the present hour, be thankful for the past, And neither fear nor wish th' approaches of the last.
Every journey into the past is complicated by delusions, false memories, false namings of real events.
Every man is his own ancestor, and every man his own heir. He devises his own fortune, and he inherits his own past.
Every man's life lies within the present; for the past is spent and done with, and the future is uncertain.
Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
Forget the past and live the present hour.
Forgiveness means giving up all hope for a better past.
Freedom from effort in the present merely means that there has been effort stored up in the past.
God cannot alter the past, but historians can.
Happiness in the present is only shattered by comparison with the past.
He is mad past recovery, but yet he has lucid intervals.
He who controls the past commands the future. He who commands the future conquers the past.
History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
I desire no future that will break the ties with the past.
I do not know which makes a man more conservative - to know nothing but the present, or nothing but the past.
I know of know way of judging the future but by the past.
I like men who have a future and women who have a past.
I love my past, I love my present. I am not ashamed of what I have had, and I am not sad because I no longer have it.
I mentioned that one of the tripartite formulas in American worldview involves time: past, present, and future.
I tend to live in the past because most of my life is there.
I think we all agree, the past is over.
I try to learn from the past, but I plan for the future by focusing exclusively on the present. That's were the fun is.
I will live in the past, the present, and the future. The spirits of all three shall strive within me.
I wouldn't put it past God to arrange a virgin birth if He wanted, but I very much doubt if He would.
If past history was all there was to the game, the richest people would be librarians.
If we examine our thoughts, we shall find them always occupied with the past and the future.
If we open a quarrel between past and present, we shall find that we have lost the future.
If we open a quarrel between the past and the present, we shall find we have lost the future.
If we've learned anything in the past quarter century, it is that we cannot federalize virtue.
In America, the photographer is not simply the person who records the past, but the one who invents it.
In books lies the soul of the whole past time.
In every conceivable manner, the family is link to our past, bridge to our future.
In order to plan your future wisely, it is necessary that you understand and appreciate your past.
In spring's own country, where the gardens blow,
In the maxim of the past you cannot go anywhere.
In the past, men created witches; now they create mental patients.
In the past, those who foolishly sought power by riding on the back of the tiger ended up inside.

Like most of those who study history, he (Napoleon III) learned from the mistakes of the past how to make new ones.
Look back, and smile at perils past.
Look back, and smile on perils past.
Look to the past and remember no empire rises that sooner or later won't fall.
Losers live in the past. Winners learn from the past and enjoy working in the present toward the future.
Man spends his life in reasoning on the past, in complaining of the present, in fearing future.
Man... cannot learn to forget, but hangs on the past: however far or fast he runs, that chain runs with him.
Many of us crucify ourselves between two thieves - regret for the past and fear of the future.
Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
Most of the problems a President has to face have their roots in the past.
No facts are to me sacred; none are profane; I simply experiment, an endless seeker, with no past at my back.
No man is rich enough to buy back his own past.
No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
Nothing is improbable until it moves into past tense.
Nothing is to come, and nothing past: But an eternal now, does always last.
Nothing that was worthy in the past departs; no truth or goodness realized by man ever dies, or can die.
One of the aged greatest miseries is that they cannot easily find a companion able to share the memories of the past.
One problem with gazing too frequently into the past is that we may turn around to find the future has run out on us.
One's past is what one is. It is the only way by which people should be judged.
Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.
Remembrance of things past.
Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
Since grief only aggravates your loss, grieve not for what is past.
Study the past if you would divine the future.
Sweet is the memory of past troubles.
Take time to gather up the past so that you will be able to draw from your experience and invest them in the future.
The age of chivalry is past. Bores have succeeded to dragons.
The best of prophets of the future is the past.
The best way to suppose what may come, is to remember what is past.
The books one has written in the past have two surprises in store: one couldn't write them again, and wouldn't want to.
The challenge of the unknown future is so much more exciting than the stories of the accomplished past.
The cradle of the future is the grave of the past.
The crux of the accounting problem with intangibles is that to know the past, one must know the future.
The darkest day, If you live till tomorrow will have past away.
The destruction of the past is perhaps the greatest of all crimes.
The diseases of the present have little in common with the diseases of the past save that we die of them.
The distinction between the past, present and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion.
The essence of statesmanship is not a rigid adherence to the past, but a prudent and probing concern for the future.
The essence of statesmanship is not a rigid adherence to the past, but a prudent and probing concern for the future.
The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditation on the past.
The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditation on the past.
The free world must not prove itself worthy of its own past.
The future comes slowly, the present flies and the past stands still forever.
The future influences the present just as much as the past.
The history of the past interests us only in so far as it illuminates the history of the present.
The human race was always interesting and we know by its past that it will always continue so, monotonously.
The lessons of the past are ignored and obliterated in a contemporary antagonism known as the generation gap.
The mind of man is capable of anything - because everything is in it, all the past as well as all the future.
The more anger towards the past you carry in your heart, the less capable you are of loving in the present.
The most conservative persons I ever met are college undergraduates. The radicals are the men past middle life.
The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
The past actually happened but history is only what someone wrote down.
The past always looks better than it was because it isn't here.
The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
The past does not equal the future.
The past grows gradually around one, like a placenta for dying.
The past is a ghost, the future a dream, and all we ever have is now.
The past is all holy to us; the dead are all holy; even they that were wicked when alive.
The past is at least secure.
The past is not a package one can lay away.
The past is prophetic in that it asserts loudly that wars are poor chisels for carving out peaceful tomorrows.
The past is the only dead thing that smells sweet.
The past is the teat that feeds those too weak to face the future
The past should be a springboard, not a hammock.
The past was erased, the erasure was forgotten, the lie became the truth.
The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities.
The people who get into trouble in our company are those who carry around the anchor of the past.
The present contains nothing more than the past, and what is found in the effect was already in the cause.
The present is just an instant between past and future
The present is the funeral of the past, and man the living sepulchre of life.
The promise given was a necessity of the past: the word broken is a necessity of the present.
The reading of all good books is like a conversation with all the finest men of past centuries.
The thought of our past years in me doth breed perpetual benedictions.
The whole past is the procession of the present.
There are certain moments when we might wish the future were built by men of the past.
There are people who have benefited from therapy without being confronted with the past at all.
There is a way to look at the past. Don't hide from it. It will not catch you - if you don't repeat it.
There is no past, so long as books shall live!
There is no time of life past learning something.
There is pleasure in calm remembrance of a past sorrow.
There's no present. There's only the immediate future and the recent past.
They spend their time looking forward to the past.
Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure.
Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
Time past and time future what might have been and what has been point to one end, which is always present.
To a father, when a child dies, the future dies; to a child when a parent dies, the past dies.

To mourn a mischief that is past and gone is the next way to draw new mischief on.

Traditionalists are pessimists about the future and optimists about the past.
Upper classes are a nation's past, the middle class its future.
Use the losses and failures of the past as a reason for action, not inaction.
View the past as your enemy, and it will be an albatross.
We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
We are not animals. We are not a product of what has happened to us in our past. We have the power of choice.
We live in the present, we dream of the future and we learn eternal truths from the past.
We make way for the man who boldly pushes past us.
We must set up a strong present tense against all rumors of wrath, past and to come.
Well, the future for me is already a thing of the past.
What is past is past, there is a future left to all men, who have the virtue to repent and the energy to atone.
Whatever has happened to you in your past has no power over this present moment, because life is now.
When much dispute has past, we find our tenets just the same as last.
When the past no longer illuminates the future, the spirit walks in darkness.
Where the mind is past hope, the heart is past shame.
While I take inspiration from the past, like most Americans, I live for the future.
Who controls the past controls the future: who controls the present controls the past.
Who controls the past, controls the future. Who controls the present, controls the past.
Who lets slip fortune, her shall never find: Occasion once past by, is bald behind.
Winners must learn to relish change with the same enthusiasm and energy that we have resisted it in the past.
Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now.
Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.
Writers are the main landmarks of the past.
You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
You can never plan the future by the past.

You change the past when you change the way you see it.
You learn from a conglomeration of the incredible past - whatever experience gotten in any way whatsoever.
You must learn from your past mistakes, but not lean on your past successes.
Your past is important, but it is not nearly as important to your present as the way you see your future.
Your past is not your potential. In any hour you can choose to liberate the future.
Your successful past will block your visions of the future.
